text:
Stormi has stopped the world from turning, and here's what the name actually means.

Kylie Jenner has officially announced the name of her daughter as Stormi, and the internet can’t get enough.

From references to the weather (“There’s expected to be Stormi weather and Reign over Chicago this weekend,” read one tweet) and questions over any hidden meanings (a link to butterflies, perhaps?), fans are pouring over the name for every possible meaning.

Here, we’ve rounded up five things to know about the name Stormi—because we know you want to know everything, naturally.

The name Stormi (as you may have guessed) has an Old English origin and stems from the word ‘Storm’—describing temperament or a weather pattern. It’s often associated with moody and mysterious characters. The name peaked in popularity in the early 1990s, with data on Think Baby Names showing an increase in popularity for the name around 1992, before dropping off closer to the millennium. No doubt baby Stormi will revisit the public conscious now that it’s got the Jenner stamp of approval. There are a number of famous celebrities called Stormi, including Stormi Bree Henley, an American model and partner of Lucky Blue Smith, but most are spelt Stormy (with the y). A number of references to storms can be seen throughout music history, including Stormy Monday by TB Walker and Stormy, by Classics IV. Although none mention any Kardashian/Jenner babies, we’ve got no doubt Travis Scott will be dropping a song (or two) about stormy weather very soon. Baby Stormi’s full name isn’t yet confirmed, but as Travis Scott’s real name is actually Jacques Webster, fans are deciding she will be named Stormi Webster. Others are saying Stormi is just it—no last name—and others are saying Jenner will hyphenate for what might be the most famous double-barreled name of the 2020s.

A fan of the name of not, there’s no doubt Kylie Jenner gets us all talking.
title: Five things to know about the history of the name Stormi
